list_definition.definition: having gained a great deal of knowledge from books or experience or both and able to use it well.

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: You would be wise to do as he suggests

list_definition.definition: in respect of or as regards

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: This new idea may prove to be difficult cost-wise.

list_ex_of_english: Still, the couple deemed it wise to do so, possibly anticipating future problems.
These wise men hold the positions of leadership and govern the country.
Thwarting permanent human interests is not a wise political strategy.
A king wishes to determine which of his three wise men is the wisest.
Once clones are evaluated on a standard rootstock, it would be wise to use this rootstock for commercial plantings.
Creative and wise people : similarities, differences, and how they develop.
We thought it wise to elect leaders in different places.
In vain would they assemble for this purpose the wisest statisticians, the most expert merchants, the most skilled manufacturers, and the ablest administrators.
